titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University MS Or 117: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār.

msContents.summary: Copy of al-Jazūlī's famous prayer book. This copy includes extensive additions in the margins as well as some blank pages at the end which have been partially filled with other prayers.

msItem.title: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār.
دلائل الخيرات و شوارق الانوار في ذكر الصلاة على النبي المختار
Dalāʼil al-Khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāt ʿalá al-nabī al-mukhtār

supportDesc.extent: 92 leaves : 212 x 162 (140 x 80) mm, bound to 215 x 165 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Naskh in black ink; pointed, partially vocalized.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrications in red; textblock border-ruled in red; red dots punctuate the text. Two full page illustrations in gold, red, and green of the the Rawḍah in Medina (f. 20v-21r).
Illustration of the Rawḍah at Mecca
Illustration of the Minbar at Mecca

binding.p: Green and black marbled paper over pasteboard.

origin.p: Likely copied in the second half of the 19th century, possibly in North Africa since the illustrations of the Rawḍa and the Minbar in Medina follow the pattern of illustration used there.
